column2: Moves blood around your body to transport oxygen, carbon dioxide, food, and waste.
Gets the important parts of food into small pieces and into your body.
Makes hormones that control your body.
Skin. It covers your insides and keeps bad stuff out.
Lets the brain sense and do things.
Brings oxygen into your blood and sends carbon dioxide out.
Gives us a shape, lets us move, protects our insides.
